message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The study utilizes data from the Global Hunger Index and Household Consumption Expenditure Data to analyze food insecurity trends in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Global Hunger Index", "Household Consumption Expenditure Data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We employed a dataset on carbon emissions from fossil fuel consumption and combustion, along with GDP data to investigate the relationship between economic growth and climate change.", "dataset": ["carbon emissions from fossil fuel consumption and combustion", "GDP data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This research uses a dataset of patent filings by firms in the pharmaceutical industry and analyzes how intellectual property rights affect the industry's competitiveness.", "dataset": ["dataset of patent filings by firms in the pharmaceutical industry"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "By using a panel dataset that includes government debt of various eurozone countries between 2010 and 2021, this paper assesses the impact of sovereign debt on economic growth.", "dataset": ["panel dataset that includes government debt of various eurozone countries between 2010 and 2021"], "topic": ["Debt", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We combine two complementary datasets, social media data and meteorological data, to analyze the effect of extreme weather events on online discussions of climate change.", "dataset": ["social media data", "meteorological data"], "topic": ["Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using the World Risk Poll and Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery datasets, we examine how disaster risk management measures can improve resilience and reduce risks for people living in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Risk Poll", "Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery datasets"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "Our research was based on a dataset provided by the Ministry of Education, and aimed to investigate how dropout rates and learning outcomes are affected by poverty and education quality in rural areas.", "dataset": ["Ministry of Education dataset"], "topic": ["Education", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We investigate the impact of renewable energy consumption on economic growth, using panel data on energy consumption and GDP from 50 countries over a period of 20 years.", "dataset": ["panel data on energy consumption and GDP from 50 countries over a period of 20 years"], "topic": ["Energy", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This study makes use of multiple datasets, including urban air quality data, meteorological data, and satellite imagery, to assess the environmental impact of transportation in cities.", "dataset": ["urban air quality data", "meteorological data", "satellite imagery"], "topic": ["Transport", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Our research is based on two complementary datasets: a dataset on household income and expenditure, and a dataset on child nutrition status, to analyze the link between household wealth and child malnutrition in developing countries.", "dataset": ["dataset on household income and expenditure", "dataset on child nutrition status"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
